contentrichtext.text: {{Coord|51|29|14.9|N|00|11|59.1|W|type:landmark_scale:3000|display=title}} [[Image:Empress State Building.JPG|thumb|right|The Empress State Building as seen from outside [[West Brompton station]], with [[Earls Court Exhibition Centre|Earls Court Two]] in the foreground.]] The '''Empress State Building''' is a skyscraper on the [[West Brompton]]/[[Earl's Court]] border in the [[London Borough of Hammersmith and Fulham]]. It was built in 1961 and was {{convert|100|m|ft|0}} tall with 28 floors, designed by Stone, Toms & Partners. It was renovated in 2003 to a design by [[Wilkinson Eyre|Wilkinson Eyre Architects]]. Three floors and {{convert|17.3|m|ft|0}} were added to its height. 'Orbit' is the name given to the private revolving bar on the top floor which offers panoramic views of London. The building is named after the [[Empress Hall]] which formerly stood on the site, and in tribute to the [[Empire State Building]]. The building is occupied by staff from the [[Metropolitan Police Service]]<ref>{{cite web |title=Earls Court redevelopment: grasping the scale |author=Dave Hill |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/society/davehillblog/2011/apr/01/earls-court-project-masterplan-exhibition |publisher=The Guardian |date=1 April 2011 |accessdate=4 December 2011|quote=Empress State Building next to Earls Court 2 (currently given over to police business that entrance security staff won't specify)}}</ref> who refer to it as ESB<ref>{{cite web|title=Student placement year with the Performance Directorate|publisher=Metropolitan Police|url=http://www.met.police.uk/pdstudents/location.htm|quote=ESB is also within an easy walking distance of Earls Court underground station}}</ref>. Some of the upper floors were occupied by staff from [[Transport for London]] until 2010. This building was originally designed as a hotel but was first used by the [[Admiralty]] and [[GCHQ]]. The Directorate of Naval Shore Telecommunications (formerly the Naval Shore Telecommunications Authority) had their National HQ office here in the 80's & 90's. ==See also== *[[Tall buildings in London]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category}} *[http://www.emporis.com/en/wm/bu/?id=110684 From emporis.com] [[Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1961]] [[Category:Skyscrapers in Hammersmith and Fulham]] [[Category:Skyscrapers between 100 and 149 meters]] [[Category:Earls Court]] {{London-struct-stub}}
